page.title: 11A DAY IN THE LIFE OF:_
page.content: Rachel's grandparents run a 150 acre dairy farm with 90 cows at Ainley Place.Her grandmother reflects that being a farmer's wife is a 24 hour job as a wife,mother,secretary,dairymaid, hostess and above all,a good cook! 'My day begins around 7.15am unless customers ring earlier to cancel milk. I make breakfast for my husband and myself;my sons and the farm workers have it between 8.30 and 10.30.Numbers vary from 4-12.After breakfast I begin the housework and prepare the mid-day meal.I often go along to the dairy and help with the bottling around 11am. Dinner is from 12.30-2.00pm and is usually a substantial meal. In the afternoon I bake,wash,clean and iron.I may help with the cows.Tea is a quieter meal.Later,I check accounts, answer mail and sort out wages,tax,vat etc.Bed-time is often mid-night.'
